TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IGatheringByteChannel implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class Java.Nio.Channels.IChannel, class Java.Nio.Channels.IWritableByteChannel, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The interface for channels that can write a set of buffers in a single operation.

remarks.para: The interface for channels that can write a set of buffers in a single operation. The corresponding interface for read operations is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Write(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] buffers) cil managed

Docs.param: the buffers containing bytes to be written.
Docs.summary: Writes bytes from all the given buffers to a channel.

remarks.para: Writes bytes from all the given buffers to a channel.
This method is equivalent to: write(buffers, 0, buffers.length);

Docs.exception: if the channel is closed by another thread during this write operation.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while the operation is in progress. The interrupt state of the calling thread is set and the channel is closed.
if offset or length , or if offset + length is greater than the size of buffers.
if another I/O error occurs; details are in the message.
if the channel has not been opened in a mode that permits writing.

MemberSignature.Value: public long Write (Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] buffers, int offset, int length);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Write(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] buffers, int32 offset, int32 length) cil managed

Docs.param: the array of byte buffers that is the source for bytes written to the channel.
the index of the first buffer in buffers to get bytes from.
the number of buffers to get bytes from.
Docs.summary: Attempts to write all remaining() bytes from length byte buffers, in order, starting at buffers[offset].

remarks.para: Attempts to write all remaining() bytes from length byte buffers, in order, starting at buffers[offset]. The number of bytes actually written is returned.
If a write operation is in progress, subsequent threads will block until the write is completed and then contend for the ability to write.

Docs.exception: if the channel is closed by another thread during this write operation.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while the operation is in progress. The interrupt state of the calling thread is set and the channel is closed.
if offset or length , or if offset + length is greater than the size of buffers.
if another I/O error occurs; details are in the message.
if the channel was not opened for writing.
